meanings.sent1: The toolbox was compartmental, with each section holding a different type of tool.
meanings.sent2: The storage unit had a compartmental design, making it easy to organize items.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces were compartmental, as if each piece belonged in its own little world.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt compartmental, with thoughts neatly separated like files in a cabinet.
meanings.sent5: The ice cube tray was compartmental, creating individual spaces for freezing water.

meanings.definition: To separate into distinct parts or categories
meanings.sent1: She compartmental her tasks for the day, assigning each one a specific time slot.
meanings.sent2: The teacher needed to compartmental the students into groups for the group project.
meanings.sent3: He tried to compartmental his emotions, keeping his sadness separate from his work.
meanings.sent4: The chef had to compartmental the ingredients before starting the recipe.
meanings.sent5: The librarian had to compartmental the books by genre to make them easier to find.
